snippet: The restaurant in Flushing says a group of elderly patrons drive away business by sitting for hours, while the group says they are entitled to take their time.
abstract: Number of elderly Korean patrons and McDonald’s in Flushing, Queens, they frequent, have been battling over the benches inside; restaurant says the people who colonize the seats on a daily basis are quashing business, taking up tables for hours while splitting a small packet of French fries; group says they are customers and entitled to take their time.

byline.original: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and JIHA HAM

headline.main: Fighting a McDonald’s in Queens for the Right to Sit. And Sit. And Sit.
